page.title: 02ELVEDEN ESTATE HISTORIC
page.content: The Elveden Estate is a large one of 23,000 acres spread over the parishes of Elveden, Eriswell and Icklingham, all of which are in the notorious Breckland.Ref. 0580 0285 for details of geology and climate. At the end of the 18C Admiral Lord Keppel owned the estate and planted many windbreaks of Scots Pines. Ref. 0576 0579. In 1801 Lord Albemarle was living there and farming 4,000 acres but the next owner, Maharajah Duleep Singh used the estate solely for game shoot- ing. By 1920-1930 Lord Iveagh of the Guiness family owned it and decided to try to reclaim much of the land for profitable farming.
